TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant was arrested . On DATE he was charged with murder .
On DATE he appeared before ORG , where Judge PERSON ordered his detention pending trial .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the decision of DATE .

In DATE the applicant learned that by Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE , the President of GPE had appointed Judge PERSON to ORG . No further decree had been issued transferring him to ORG . The applicant immediately lodged a complaint to ORG challenging the lawfulness of the decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG replied that the impugned decision had been fully lawful .

The Government provided the ORG with a copy of a decree , issued on CARDINAL DATE by the President of ORG , according to which the duties of a temporarily absent judge of that court were to be performed by Judge PERSON with effect from CARDINAL DATE .
“ CARDINAL . No one may be deprived of the right to have his or her case considered by the court and judge on which cognisance of the case is conferred by law . ”
“ .. CARDINAL . Judges of ... the federal courts shall be appointed by the President of GPE according to the rules laid down by federal law ... ”

“ ... In the event of the temporary absence of a judge of a district ( town ) court , his duties shall be performed by a judge of the nearest district ( town ) court by decision of the President of a higher court ... ”

In Decision no . CARDINAL-O - O of DATE , ORG held as follows : “ According to LAW ( part CARDINAL ) , no one may be deprived of the right to have his or her case considered by the court and judge on which cognisance of the case is conferred by law ...

The legislator , in exercising legal regulation in the judicial sphere in order to secure the right of citizens and associations to judicial protection within a reasonable time , has the power to determine the organisational and procedural arrangements for the district ( town ) courts , including the arrangements for replacing temporarily absent judges . The PERSON on organisation of the courts in the ORG provides that in the event of the temporary absence of a judge of a district ( town ) court , his duties shall be performed by a judge of the nearest district ( town ) court , the arrangements for his replacement being made by decision of the President of a higher court . Therefore , the impugned provision , being aimed at securing the smooth operation of justice in the event of the temporary absence of a judge , does not impair any constitutional right of the applicant in his specific case .

... The principles of independence and irremovability of judges guaranteed by LAW are not violated by LAW on organisation of the courts in the ORG , as the fact that the duties of a temporarily absent judge of a district ( town ) court are performed by a judge of the nearest district ( town ) court does not amount to the transfer of a judge to another position or another court . A judge preserves his powers , office , position and grade for the whole period of his activity within a judicial body ... ”
